settings.heading: Custom Block
settings.text:
Custom CMS block displayed at the left sidebar on the Catalog Page. Put your own content here: text, html, images, media... or whatever you like.

There are many similar sample content placeholders across the store. All editable from admin panel.

settings.heading: What inspired us to reinvent thermals?

settings.content_top:
In the early days of Kosha, a client showed up requesting a base layer for the New York Marathon, at the time we didn’t have what he was
looking for. That’s where it all began and we went on to innovate the Kosha’s Base Layers - India’s first temperature regulating thermal with
feature rich fabrics! Not only is it softer & lighter than traditional thermals but it also doubles up as a stylish tee or legging. It’s special anti-
odour, quick dry, eco-friendly properties level it up for adventure.

settings.heading: Jaya Vazirani
settings.body: We went to Norway for a conference and used Kosha winter wear. Thermals were very light weight, soft, comfortable and very warm. Excellent woollen socks. Because of this we could bear Norway's cold weather.

settings.heading: Ankit Shah
settings.body: Kosha has amazing stuff for winters. If you need thermal wear which is comfortable and lightweight at the same time, you can visit the store and buy their products which not only look good but are also body-friendly. Their thermals have been tested up to 15 to -20 degrees. They have also got a few amazing jackets, which are 4-in-1, and can be used in monsoons too. High five to Vanishree, who is superb. The staff is really friendly and will help you out with your needs. Kudos!

settings.heading: Anil Tayade
settings.body: Wonderful place for an overseas travel kit. Everything under one roof. Great service, great product, and a wonderful team to look after your needs.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do I need to wear thermals? +

Ideally, thermals are to be worn when the temperature goes below 10°C. It can go up or down depending on your body’s temperature-withstanding capability. The main duty of the thermals is to keep your body warm and dry. They are moisture-wicking and breathable. So, if you don’t wear thermals under your regular clothes, then when you sweat, your clothes will get wet which can make you feel itchy and in the worst-case scenario even hypothermia. Hence, it is always advisable to wear thermals as your first layer when in the cold and then layer it up with your regular clothes, sweaters, and jackets.

How to choose thermals? +

Choosing the right thermal depends on several factors including the occasion, temperature range, fabric, and the activities you may participate in.

Generally, there are three fabric compositions in which the thermals come- polyester blend, cotton & wool. Wool is the most preferred out of the three as it is the warmest. Depending on the occasion and activity, you may choose a lightweight thermal and later layer up depending on your demands. There are also options for temperature-adaptive thermal wear which keep you warm and then adapt as the temperature gets warmer. This also helps you reduce the need for other layers.

Should thermals be tight or loose? +

Choosing the right thermal can be a troublesome process for many. Take precise body measurements and compare them to our size guide to unlock the perfect fit. Thermals are always better in a snug and comfortable fit. It needs to be worn closer to your body. If it's too loose, it will not serve the purpose of keeping you warm. So, if you find yourself straddling two sizes, remember: for thermals, go for the smaller size.

How frequently should I wash my thermals? +

Merino Wool is a delicate fiber, treat it gently. As one sweats less in winter, avoid over-washing this garment to keep the fabric newer and longer. Its inbuilt moisture-wicking and odor-resistant properties allow it to be worn for 3 to 5 days at a time without washing.

What makes Kosha thermal special? +

Our thermal wear is made of a unique combination of fine merino wool and bamboo. Unlike traditional thermals, we designed it such that you won't feel bulky when wearing it. It is lightweight, warm, anti-odor, and temperature-regulating. This indicates that you can now double up the same thermal as a T-shirt when it is warm. We have tested our thermals for 15°C to -20°C. You can easily use them for more than 200 washes without compromising the quality.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do I need to wear thermals? +

Ideally, thermals are to be worn when the temperature goes below 10°C. It can go up or down depending on your body’s temperature-withstanding capability. The main duty of the thermals is to keep your body warm and dry. They are moisture-wicking and breathable. So, if you don’t wear thermals under your regular clothes, then when you sweat, your clothes will get wet which can make you feel itchy and in the worst-case scenario even hypothermia. Hence, it is always advisable to wear thermals as your first layer when in the cold and then layer it up with your regular clothes, sweaters, and jackets.

How to choose thermals? +

Choosing the right thermal depends on several factors including the occasion, temperature range, fabric, and the activities you may participate in.

Generally, there are three fabric compositions in which the thermals come- polyester blend, cotton & wool. Wool is the most preferred out of the three as it is the warmest. Depending on the occasion and activity, you may choose a lightweight thermal and later layer up depending on your demands. There are also options for temperature-adaptive thermal wear which keep you warm and then adapt as the temperature gets warmer. This also helps you reduce the need for other layers.

If you need further help knowing more about thermals you can check them out here.

Should thermals be tight or loose? +

Choosing the right thermal can be a troublesome process for many. Take precise body measurements and compare them to our size guide to unlock the perfect fit. Thermals are always better in a snug and comfortable fit. It needs to be worn closer to your body. If it's too loose, it will not serve the purpose of keeping you warm. So, if you find yourself straddling two sizes, remember: for thermals, go for the smaller size.

How frequently should I wash my thermals? +

A: Merino Wool is a delicate fiber, treat it gently.

As one sweats less in winter, avoid over-washing this garment to keep the fabric newer and longer. Its inbuilt moisture-wicking and odour-resistant properties allow it to be worn for 3 to 5 days at a time without washing.

If your travel plans are slightly longer (more than a week), it is better to take 2 thermal sets* - use one for the daytime and one for the night. That way, in the nighttime you can air dry your used thermal and have a fresh thermal at night instead of wearing it for more than 12 hours.

*Please note that the number of thermal sets that you may need will also vary on the place, activity, and body type. If you are going to be indulging in an outdoor sport, which may cause you to sweat a lot, it is better to carry more thermals and vice versa.

What makes Kosha thermal special? +

Our thermal wear is made of a unique combination of fine merino wool and bamboo. Unlike traditional thermals, we designed it such that you won't feel bulky when wearing it. It is lightweight, warm, anti-odor, and temperature-regulating. This indicates that you can now double up the same thermal as a T-shirt when it is warm. We have tested our thermals for 15°C to -20°C. You can easily use them for more than 200 washes without compromising the quality.

Bonus: They also come in a cute reusable jute bag that helps you carry your layers in the cold! Now go for your winter runs, snowy adventures, or cozy getaways in style.

It is too thin. Will it keep me warm? +

Absolutely!

One thing we want to stress about Kosha’s thermal is that it is made lightweight consciously. We didn't want the bulkiness of the regular thermal to weigh you down and hinder your comfort. So even though it is thin, it is designed intentionally without compromising on the warmth or performance.

Further, our thermals are tested by real-life testers in temperatures ranging from -20°C to 15°C. So, you can enjoy your adventure without worries with our thermals.

Can you wear 2 thermals for extreme cold? +

Of course!

Kosha thermals will keep you warm up to 10°C when worn as is. If you wear them with other layers like jackets and sweaters, they will help you feel comfortable even at -10°C. If you are feeling cold at any temperature, it is a great idea to wear another thermal over the one you are wearing. This is also a great idea when you are traveling to any Scandinavian country wherein the windchill factor is common. You can also wear two thermals when there is a drastic change in the temperature and it takes some time for the body to acclimatize.
